Class Ui

java.lang.Object
  greenfoot.Actor
      Ui

public class Ui
extends greenfoot.Actor

The User Interface; the screen that shows up on the bottom
It changes every time the user selects something
It creates buttons when the user selects specific objects, and removes them when they are not needed

Version:
(1.0)
Author:
James Lu, Terence Lai

Constructor Summary
Ui()
           
 
Method Summary
 void act()
           
protected  void addedToWorld(greenfoot.World world)
           
 void changeUi(int id)
          changes the ui to fit the user's selection
0 for general ui
1 for building a tower
2 for sending creeps
3 for selected a tower
4 for selecting a tower during the buy
5 for selecting a mob
 Button getButton(int n, int id)
          returns a certain button
n = 0 is for the buttons to send creeps
n = 1 is for the buttons to build towers
 int getId()
          returns the stage of this Ui
0 for general ui
1 for building a tower
2 for sending creeps
3 for selected a tower
4 for selecting a tower during the buy
5 for selecting a mob
 Enemy getMob()
          Returns the current mob that the Ui is displaying
 void setGeneralData(int lives, int gold, int income)
          Sets the general data of the ui:
The number of lives
The current gold
and the income
 void setMobData(Enemy e)
          Sets the enemy data for the Ui
The Ui calls upon the passed enemy to display it's stats
 void setTowerData(Tower t)
          Sets the tower data for the Ui
The Ui calls upon the passed tower to display it's stats
 void setWaveData(int current, int Next)
          Sets the wave data of the current and next wave
The paramaters are int ids of the current and next wave
